title: MAC-Forced Forwarding: A Method for Subscriber Separation on an Ethernet Access Network
abstract:
This document describes a mechanism to ensure layer-2 separation of
Local Area Network (LAN) stations accessing an IPv4 gateway over a
bridged Ethernet segment.

The mechanism - called "MAC-Forced Forwarding" - implements an Address
Resolution Protocol (ARP) proxy function that prohibits Ethernet Media
Access Control (MAC) address
resolution between hosts located within the same IPv4 subnet but at
different customer premises, and in effect directs all upstream
traffic to an IPv4 gateway.  The IPv4 gateway provides IP-layer
connectivity between these same hosts.  This memo provides information for the Internet community.
